snippet: The group, which includes Google’s executive chairman and Bill Richardson, a former governor of New Mexico, also called on North Korea to put a moratorium on missile launchings.
abstract: Private delegation to North Korea that includes Google's executive chairman Eric E Schmidt is urging North to allow more open Internet access and cellphones, although it is unclear how that message is being heard by leadership that has long depended on near-total ban on outside information to maintain its totalitarian rule.
lead_paragraph: The group, which includes Google’s executive chairman and Bill Richardson, a former governor of New Mexico, also called on North Korea to put a moratorium on missile launchings.

headline.seo: Delegation to North Korea Urges More Access to Internet and Cellphones
headline.main: Delegation From U.S. Urges Web Access in North Korea
headline.print_headline: Americans Urge Web Access in North Korea
